label: ABC2_mC32_15_2e_2e_2f-002
title: $\beta'$-LiFeO$_{2}$ Structure
comments:
FeLiO$_{2}$ exhibits a wide variety of structures, with the exact structure present depends on thermodynamic effects, preparation methods, and charge/discharge history. 
 We follow the nomenclature of (Kanno, 1996), where appropriate, with modifications found in (Tabuchi, 1995) and (Abdel-Ghany, 2012). The following list of structures is no doubt incomplete: \begin{itemize} \item $\alpha$-LiFeO$_{2}$ is in the \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cF8_225_a_b-001}{cubic rock salt ($B1$) structure}, with lithium and iron randomly placed on the sodium site and oxygen on the chlorine site. It is synthesized at temperatures above $600^{\circ}$C. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_tI4_139_a_b-003}{$\beta$-LiFeO$_{2}$} is a tetragonal distortion of $\alpha$-LiFeO$_{2}$ with the lithium and iron atoms still randomly placed on their sublattice. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_mC32_15_2e_2e_2f-002}{$\beta'$-LiFeO$_{2}$} (this structure) is monoclinic and transforms to $\gamma$-LiFeO$_{2}$ near room temperature.  This is likely the phase (Kanno, 1996) refers to as $\beta$-LiFeO$_{2}$. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_tI16_141_a_b_e-003}{$\gamma$-LiFeO$_{2}$} is created by low-temperature synthesis below $500^{\circ}$C and can be considered as an ordered version of $\alpha$-LiFeO$_{2}$, with a doubled unit cell. \item \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC2_oP8_59_a_a_2b-004}{o-LiFeO$_{2}$} is orthorhombic, produced by an ion exchange interaction. It is (meta)-stable below $400^{\circ}$C, transforming to $\alpha$-LiFeO$_{2}$ above $600^{\circ}$C. \end{itemize} ~ \vspace{-.25in} 
 As with $\alpha$- and $\beta$-LiFeO$_{2}$, so of the iron and lithium atoms in $\beta$'-LiFeO$_{2}$ are partially disordered.  The Fe-I site is 56\% iron and 46\% lithium, while the Li-I site is 46\% iron and 54\% lithium.  The Fe-II and Li-II sites are fully ordered. 
 Some other sources use ErNaO$_{2}$ as the prototype.  We choose $\beta'$-LiFeO$_{2}$ to highlight the connection with the other LiFeO$_{2}$ structures.
